intro: Tetraplandra kuhlmannii, commonly known as the Kuhlmann's tetraplandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
